name: SPIRIT
description: Standard Protocol Items: Recommendations for Interventional Trials

items.description: Descriptive title identifying the study design, population, interventions, and, if applicable, trial acronym
items.example: A randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of intervention X in patients with condition Y: the ACRONYM study

items.description: Trial identifier and registry name. If not yet registered, name of intended registry
items.example: ClinicalTrials.gov identifier: NCT12345678

items.description: All items from the World Health Organization Trial Registration Data Set
items.example: WHO Trial Registration Data Set items included

items.description: Date and version identifier
items.example: Protocol version 2.0, dated 15 March 2023

items.description: Sources and types of financial, material, and other support
items.example: This study is funded by...

items.description: Names, affiliations, and roles of protocol contributors
items.example: Principal Investigator: Dr. X (University Y), Co-investigators: ...

items.description: Description of research question and justification for undertaking the trial
items.example: Current evidence suggests... However, gaps remain in...

items.description: Explanation for choice of comparators
items.example: The control intervention was chosen because...

items.description: Specific objectives or hypotheses
items.example: Primary objective: To determine whether... Secondary objectives: ...

items.description: Description of study settings and list of centres or sites
items.example: This multi-center trial will be conducted at 5 academic hospitals

items.description: Inclusion and exclusion criteria for participants
items.example: Inclusion criteria: 1) Age 18-65 years, 2) Diagnosed with...

items.description: Interventions for each group with sufficient detail
items.example: Experimental group: Participants will receive... Control group: ...

items.description: Primary outcome(s) and metric(s) used
items.example: Primary outcome: Change in symptom severity score from baseline to 12 weeks

items.description: Secondary outcome(s) and metric(s) used
items.example: Secondary outcomes include: 1) Quality of life scores, 2) Adverse events

items.description: Time schedule of enrolment, interventions, assessments, and visits
items.example: Screening visit: Week -2, Baseline: Week 0, Follow-up visits: Weeks 4, 8, 12

items.description: Estimated number of participants needed to achieve study objectives
items.example: A total of 200 participants (100 per group) will be enrolled

items.description: Strategies for achieving adequate participant enrolment
items.example: Participants will be recruited from outpatient clinics and through advertisements

items.description: Method of generating the allocation sequence
items.example: Computer-generated randomisation sequence with permuted blocks

items.description: Mechanism of implementing the allocation sequence
items.example: Sealed, opaque envelopes will be used for allocation concealment

items.description: Who will generate the allocation sequence, enrol participants, and assign to interventions
items.example: The statistician will generate the sequence, research nurses will enroll participants

items.description: Who will be blinded after assignment to interventions
items.example: Participants, investigators, and outcome assessors will be blinded

items.description: Procedure for emergency unblinding of trial participants
items.example: Emergency unblinding will be available 24/7 through...

items.section: Methods: Data collection, management, and analysis
items.description: Plans for assessment and collection of outcome, baseline, and other trial data
items.example: Data will be collected using validated questionnaires and clinical assessments

items.section: Methods: Data collection, management, and analysis
items.description: Plans to promote data quality
items.example: Data will be entered into a secure electronic database with range checks

items.section: Methods: Data collection, management, and analysis
items.description: Statistical methods for analysing primary and secondary outcomes
items.example: Primary analysis will use intention-to-treat principle with mixed-effects models

items.description: Composition of data monitoring committee and its role and reporting structure
items.example: An independent Data Monitoring Committee will review safety data

items.description: Plans for collecting, assessing, and reporting harms
items.example: Adverse events will be collected and graded according to CTCAE criteria

items.description: Frequency and procedures for auditing trial conduct
items.example: Site monitoring visits will occur every 6 months

items.description: Plans for seeking research ethics committee/institutional review board approval
items.example: Ethics approval will be obtained from the institutional review board

items.description: Plans for communicating important protocol amendments to relevant parties
items.example: Protocol amendments will be submitted to the IRB and trial registry

items.description: Model consent form and other related documentation given to participants
items.example: Written informed consent will be obtained from all participants

items.description: How personal information about potential and enrolled participants will be protected
items.example: Participant data will be de-identified and stored securely

items.description: Financial and other competing interests for principal investigators for the overall trial
items.example: Dr. X has received consulting fees from pharmaceutical company Y

items.description: Statement of who will have access to the final trial dataset
items.example: The principal investigator will have access to the final dataset

items.description: Provisions, if any, for ancillary and post-trial care
items.example: Participants will receive standard care after trial completion

items.description: Plans for investigators and sponsor to communicate trial results
items.example: Results will be published in peer-reviewed journals regardless of outcome
